Structure: 50 credit points
The Project Management specialisation is completed by undertaking specific subjects (50 credit points embedded within Year 2 and 3 requirements).
Note:

Students entering the course with advanced standing who plan on completing a specialisation may need to enrol in core specialisation subjects in their commencing semester. Please check and follow the structure outlined for your intended specialisation and seek course planning advice.
To obtain a specialisation in Project Management, students must complete:
12.5 credit points of Year 2 core specialisation subject
75 credit points of Year 2 compulsory subjects
12.5 credit points of Year 2 selective subjects
37.5 credit points of Year 3 core specialisation subjects
37.5 credit points of Year 3 compulsory subjects
Year 1:
100 credit points of Year 1 compulsory subjects
Year 2:
12.5 credit points of Year 2 core specialisation subjects
75 credit points of Year 2 compulsory subjects
12.5 credit points of Year 2 selective subjects
Year 3:
37.5 credit points of Year 3 core specialisation subjects
37.5 credit points Year 3 compulsory subjects
25 credit points of Year 3 Capstone subjects
Subject Options: Refer to the Course Structure page for Year 1 compulsory and Year 3 capstone subjects.
(Must be completed in Year 3 of the course)
